Reviews.Title: “Not The best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: terri b
Reviews.Content: I traveled here on business and this was not the best hotel. It was a very short stay and the hotel was really a long way from the airport. It was old and I was disturbed by the front desk associates speaking spanish in front of me when I went to the desk to ask questions and I only speak english. There wasnt another person around but me and I thought it was rude. I was only there a day and a half. I had breakfast there and it was ok. the rooms were dated and I really did not feel safe because of the neighborhood the hotel was in. I rarely write bad reviews and am very lenient when commenting on old hotels if the service is good, that was not the case with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the hotel name.”
Reviews.Author: TheBigTraveler
Reviews.Content: One would think this hotel is near the Miami airport. It is in fact in Hialeah, closer to North Miami, and in is a 17 to 25 minute drive. I called the hotel before booking to ask about their airport shuttle service and to ask if it would be running if I arrived after 11:00 PM. I was informed there was a shuttle service and the time wasn't a problem. My plane arrived at 11:30 PM and I made my way to the Hotel Bus pickup location. After a minute wait I called the hotel and was told the bus had stopped running at 11 PM. Did I say I called the Hotel after booking, through their booking service, to inform them of my late arrival. I ended up taking a 29 dollar cab ride. Also, my traveling companion and I did not get the King Bed we paid for 5 weeks before our stay. We were comped breakfast, a 13 dollar value for two. I did not ask how close it was to the airport but relied on the name to put it close by. My mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated HJ - for short stay”
Reviews.Author: supergaggle
Reviews.Content: This a well situated Hojo for short stays. If your looking for lodging in Miami for more than a week with the kids, look elsewhere. This property is ideal if your in the Miami area for a couple days on a stopover between flights or a cruise. Well situated, straddling the 826 - quick access to all points. What I especially liked about this hotel was its construction. Since it's a older property and somewhat like an office building, its concrete - steel reinforced so very quiet. I stayed in a double on the 9th floor. Quick, fast elevators. Had to go one floor lower for ice but no big deal, can use the stairs. Clean, well maintained pool as well with operational hot tub alongside. Fresh water shower not working. In house fitness room was closed but hotel does provide free passes to gym across the street. Good one too. Accommodations were decent and clean. Double bed and pillows of average quality. TV with plenty of channels. Room carpet could use a serious deep cleaning. Not to mention the hallways. (I don't understand why hotels do not clean carpets more often. Little things like that can go a long way in improving guest experience). The bathroom/toilet was a little worse for wear but clean enough. Note: Room windows do not open. Staff was all round very pleasant. The front desk staff and housekeeping personnel especially helpful and friendly. This is a big property, so I can imagine the stress on the entire team to meet all guests expectations. Concierge even heated my soup up for me in the staff microwave. No question I would stay here again. The rate is competitive - period. Free parking and free wireless internet throughout the property.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay here,unclean & nowhere near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: istanbultrip059
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i have seen in america, period! Booked in advance, with shuttle from the airport. The shuttle never came after waiting an hour, we had to spend over $30 to get to the hotel. When we arrived there were four people in front of us complaining about the smell and cleanliness. When it was our turn I mentioned the missing shuttle and was informed that it wasn't missing it was doing a shopping trip. Unbelievable. I was then told that this was normal and was presented with the schedule from the duty manager. I said that this was not stated anywhere on our booking info or on their website, the reply "it would't be sir as true website does not publish this". I then asked to see the room after hearing others complain. I was shown a room that was unclean, stank, and was built in the 70's. I returned to reception where my other half was waiting and explained that we were not staying and wished to cancel our reservation. At this point another ember of staff joined the duty manger and both were unhelpful and rude. At first they refused to give us any further help, I had to argue to get them to write our cancellation number on their letterhead which they pretended not to have. After 5 minutes of arguing they finally opened a drawer and wrote our cancellation number on letterhead. I can not stress enough how dirty the hotel was and how rude the staff were. The hotel is also over half an hour away from the airport, when I stated that this was not an airport hotel they claimed that they were the nearest Howard Johnsons to the airport so this is why they called themselves an airport hotel. Even this hotel is cheap it is not worth it, quite honestly we will never even think of staying at one of these places again, Howard Johnson needs to sort this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Third world hotel”
Reviews.Author: cooldr2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel reflects a hotel in the Third World. It's like a hotel in a popular neighborhood in Cuba. The service is mediocre, the hotel is very dirty. The elevators are broken. The internet not working. With your breakfast , you can have a cafe but no juice, or juice but no coffee. All is restricted. I do not recommend anyone to spend a night there. You will regret it so much as I regret paying $ 145 a night in a hole that does not even deserve the price of a one star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frank F
Reviews.Content: We are repeat clients and booked 3 nights King non smoking Penthouse room.For the money all is fine,Comfortable bed,clean bathroom.Would use again.Only thing I left my jacket in the closet and after calling front desk was told they would mail it my expense of course.We'll see.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: GoofysDad
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a one night stay prior to a cruise so I didnâ€™t need anything fancy. My usual hotels were [priced way above what I usually pay, probably due to the time of the year. So I went too Priceline and bid a few times. Ended up with this hotel. Not a dump but it wasnâ€™t very good either. The whole hotel is very worn. I canâ€™t really say it was dirty, just it couldnâ€™t get any cleaner due to the wear. Upon check in we received 2 double beds in a smoking room. They said that since we went through an outside provide that this is what we get. The room did smell of smoke but it wasnâ€™t the end of the world once you get used to it. Unfortunately the windows do not open so I couldnâ€™t air the room out. The folks that work there seemed OK, not overly friendly but not rude either. Sheets didnâ€™t really fit the bed. Actually the sheets were OK it was he mattress pad. It was so stretched out of shape that it had large creases in it. Couldnâ€™t get it to lay flat for the life of me. If I have a choice I wouldnâ€™t stay there again. Iâ€™d pay a bit more to move to another hotel. Maybe if we had a non-smoking room I might be persuaded, not sure.

Reviews.Title: “OK FOR OVERNIGHT STOP”
Reviews.Author: Patsy487
Reviews.Content: Just used as an overnight stop after arriving in Miami before travelling on to Clearwater. Hotel was basic, a little tired but served the purpose. Would not use again if in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: MommaBear2011
Reviews.Content: I thought the location was great! Near the airport and walking distance from plenty shopping. Taxis are readily available nearby and there is also a bus stop nearby. The staff was very friendly. I thought the restaurant was fine too. The hotel is a little bit rund down, but I can over look that. My one complaint was that there is no mini-bar / fridge in the room, and the coffee maker is in the bathroom, and they were really stingy with the coffee - supplying only one pack of decaf and one pack of regular. Really not enough.

Reviews.Title: “bad location and dirty”
Reviews.Author: manderific
Reviews.Content: I don't know where all these positive reviews are coming from. My boyfriend and I got put up here by Delta when we got bumped from my flight back from Cancun. I wouldn't even normally review a place like this, but our short experience there was so unfortunate that I feel I have to. What a terrible way to end a vacation. The hotel shuttle only comes once every 2 hours, and we had to wait 90 mins for it - we couldn't take a cab because there was some confusion over the address (we had to confer with another couple who also got bumped by Delta) - according to our vouchers from Delta, the phone number matched a Howard Johnson somewhere on the beach in Miami, and we didn't have a street address. We finally got there (it is 25 minutes from the airport with no traffic - unclear how it's considered an airport hotel), and what a disappointment. The room was dirty - the floor looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in months, bathroom floor and shower were stained and looked unclean, and the covers on the bed (which I tried to touch as little as possible) were also stained and torn. The room was so stuffy and hot that the windows were completely covered in condensation from the inside and we couldn't get the AC to cool it. We had to eat dinner at the hotel restaurant - the only saving grace was the manager there, who actually displayed genuine courteous and competent customer service, unlike the rest of his staff. Our waitress lost our order, and neglected to ever tell us that they'd run out of hamburgers, over an hour after my boyfriend ordered his. The fact that Delta puts anyone up here is absurd. Avoid at all costs - given the numerous other hotel shuttles at the Miami airport, which circled by multiple times an hour - there are plenty of other hotels where you can stay if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice best stay in Miami thus far”
Reviews.Author: Bajan4eva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at ramada for yrs and was so disappointed,not knowing greener pastures were a stone throw away.Rooms are clean,great location,staff are super friendly make u feel welcomed.I would recommend any one to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful of the Location”
Reviews.Author: PatricioT-Argentina
Reviews.Content: The hotel was Overall fine, but just wanted to mention 2 issues: 1- Breakfast is poor, just some eggs, bacon and potatoes and you have to either choose between coffee and orange juice or pay additional for both... 2- Location, the hotel is about 40 minutes drive from South Beach and 15minutes drive from the airport. The only Mall which is "nearby" is Dolphin Mall which is about 10 minutes drive. Above that, the rooms were clean and the service was fine. I only had some isues with some vending machines and the Front desk employee returned my money just by telling the story. So, as long as you are well aware of the location, I could recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: MARIA I
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel very much! It was recently renovated and its looking really good! This hotel gives the feeling of being on a vacation. Almost everyone speaks english... The only challenged I encountered was at checkin, the agent quoted me one rate and I paid the total that was quoted only to be told later that he had quoted me an incorrect rate. I really felt I should not have paid the difference, this is the third year I had a challeged at checkin and some members of the group indicated they would try another hotel next year. The Front Office Manager Lorenzo was very helpful during our entire stay, he made sure we had an ajoining room. Also Maurice the Bell Captain was indeed the gem of the hotel. Over all I think you should have a special rate for guests who stayed at the hotel more than ten times. More

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: lejo1831
Reviews.Content: My stay here was excellent. i recommend it. the staff was very friendly and the rooms were very neat.

Reviews.Title: “Failure to deliver”
Reviews.Author: Gaynelle M
Reviews.Content: Two packages were sent to the hotel to meet me when I arrived. The person who sent it said there were two items. The first thing I noticed is that when the packages did arrive no one said anything so I had to keep calling front desk to enquire. Sure enough the box arrive and two items were in the box. Assuming those were the "packages", I left the hotel and the country only to discover there was another box left behind no one told me about. Imagine my horror when I made seven calls to enquire about shipping it to me, the bell man says they don't want to have to incur the cost, and it would be better to send OVERSEAS to collect the package. Are you kidding me??

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Smelly, and Inconsiderate”
Reviews.Author: JBT1968
Reviews.Content: We purchased a stay at this hotel via Priceline. We later found out that this hotel seems to treat "discount" customers differently. A call ahead of time to request a non-smoking room with double beds was fruitless. We were told that such requests could not be honored, and there would be an additional charge for a rollaway bed. The hotel room itself was smoke-filled (as was the hallway and the elevator area of the fourth floor), and the furniture and curtains had cigarette burns. The bathroom floor had been cleaned, but not for at least three months. The room stunk of smoke, and blankets on the bed were stained and discolored. The hotel staff said that there were no other rooms available at all. We booked another hotel at nearly twice the price, and checked out. When the hotel staff found that we were leaving, they "suddenly" found available non-smoking rooms for us. Too late. We left. Unfortunately, we left an item behind. Calls to the front desk and to housekeeping were answered with the claim that we had not left an item behind. We were assured that someone had checked and that the item was not there. We returned to the hotel (a 20 mile trip) and demanded a key to the room. The item that we were told was not there was still sitting where we'd told the hotel staff it was; they had clearly not even bothered to check for us. The hotel is disgusting, unclean, and stinks of smoke. The hotel staff does not care about the comfort of guests. Traffic noise from 826 (including sirens) and the continual thump of music from the cantina four floors below make getting a decent night's sleep impossible. Given the opportunity to stay at this hotel again for free, I would instead opt to sleep in my car.

Reviews.Title: “An honest manager”
Reviews.Author: terouna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Johnson Plaza located 7707 NW 103rd st Miami Fl. I accidently left my laptop outside on the bench infront of the hotel's lobby. Mr. Lorenze Olmeda who is the Hotel's front office manager found it and kept it in posession until I collect it. Thanks Mr. Olmede you' proved that there are honest people around. By being honest and very customer friendly it clearly showed that you're an asset to this establishment. Thanks a lot I highly reccomend your hotel to anyone who wants to be in a friendly warm safe environment

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stays and shopping!!”
Reviews.Author: Bajanbrit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for short stays especially if you want to get around to the shopping spots easily. Not near the airport, but it is the best hotel to stay at in the Hialeah area. The rooms are not as clean as I would like. Once I stayed there in transit to Atlanta with my daughter and her socks were BLACK from walking on the floor of the room. But the beds are okay. The bellman are wonderful and very helpful. They are usually willing to give you a late checkout if available when you are traveling with kids. The shuttle for shopping is great, and it works going back to the airport. But don't expect a shuttle coming from the airport. Get a taxi or be prepared to wait FOREVER. You have to ask for a fridge, kettle or microwave if you need that with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Terri R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the way back to Dayton, Ohio. The staff will bend over backwards to accommodate you, including moving us to the side of the hotel opposite the noise from the club downstairs. Rooms are very comfortable and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall ok”
Reviews.Author: Bajanbabe60
Reviews.Content: Shuttle service from airport is horrid, had to wait almost 2 hours. The rooms were clean. Dont know if i would say the staff was friendly. I just think they were doing their jobs. The bellmen were great. Good for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marcello D
Reviews.Content: Very bad hotel! Besides the bad service, is extremely insecure! I was robbed in my hotel room and took no action, I was treated with total disrespect! Do not stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay at this hotel next time i'm in Miami :)”
Reviews.Author: TriniTourist
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel three times and I'd keep staying here every time I decide to visit Miami. I've reviewed this hotel before and I'm reviewing it again since I stayed this month (August 2011). My previous visit to this hotel (july 2009) was simply ok. This time it was way better. The renovations are completed and the hotel is simply exotic. Rooms are clean, staff is very friendly and VERY helpful, the gift shop have some nice stuff, the pool is very nice, beds are comfortable, bathrooms are clean and the concierge service is really really good. This hotel makes me feel at home. My only problem is the restaurant. The restaurant is not bad but not great either. There needs to be more variety in food (thats my only complain). Overall, I love this hotel, its simply great and exotic and deluxe and comfortable. The shuttle service is also really good and on time. Definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!...

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: annapink
Reviews.Content: You need to know something before you'll get there. They barely speak english, at the front desk they do, but breakfast or housekeeping staff does not, at all. Even if you don't resemble spanish they won't even try to speak to you in english. Men at the front desk seem like they don't know or don't want to work. Everything is slow. Especially I didn't like one there, resembles Homer Simpson's boss, he was starring at me which I didn't appreciate at all and once when I was alone he wanted to have a conversation with me. Be prepared if you decide to go for breakfast - first go to the front desk and ask for a "breakfast badge", then go to their restaurant, a lady will show you where to seat, don't even think about sitting somewhere else (once we met our friends there and started talking - a lady was screaming at us in spanish through all the restaurant that we had to come because she was waiting). The breakfast is always the same and bad: powdered eggs mixed in water, super fat bacon and potatoes, looks better than taste. You can always order from menu and you will pay around $12.34, but you will still have those great eggs so don't bother. Breakfast is till 11am, I learned it when they didn't want to serve my friend at that time. There's one thing bothering me - I found a very dried piece of eggs on my plate so I think they just give us somebody's leftovers! Rooms are quite dirty, but fortunately bed was ok and seemed clean (no bed bugs). Coffee maker you will find in the bathroom (!). Towels are small. Pool towels seem hospital ones. Pool is ok though. Ah and there's a $1/day charge for a safe usage. Summary: the hotel is ok, but service is bad. I rather will not come back there.

Reviews.Title: “What a nasty Hotel, horrible surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Eileenev
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip with my husband and our 15 months old son. We where supposed to meet with my MIL and her husband there. First, I totally agree with some people that say "why is this under airport hotels?" It's very far from the airport, like 20 minutes from it. The area is Hialeah and it's awful and dangerous. When I arrived to the hotel the two things I remember are that nobody helped us with our things (we were loaded with baby, lugages, stroller, baby car seat, etc) and that there was a table with a glittery tablecloth and fake flowers, so cheap and tacky. The room seemed dirty, the carpets where dirty, my son walked a little and his socks where black! The food was terrible and they took forever to bring the food to the room. All I wanted was to get out of this hotel. The best: Anything! The least: everything

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, terrible food”
Reviews.Author: Lianne20
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for our Easter and by day 2 our trip was ruined. My husband and I got food poisoning from the hotel restaurant food and was throwing up and experiencing diarrhea all night and into the morning. When i called for assistance the 'hotel manager' advised that i take a taxi to the nearest pharmacy. We have 2 toddlers so this was not an option at 2am!! In the morning i wrote a complaint to the restaurant manager and was offered fruits and a bottle of water. When we tried to find out how far our complaint had reached and if we were being taken serious we were told that the manager was not available and that he had already given us a bowl or fruit. This was our first family vacation to the USA and to Howard Johnson hotel. If this is the kind of service being offered you can bet we'll never be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Different from our last stay :(”
Reviews.Author: EyeCandy00
Reviews.Content: Our last stay back in March was good. This time was a little different. On the 1st day, my husband knew the AC wasn't working properly. We lowered the temp. in our room all the way, but the room never got cold, it was just "cool".The 2nd day, when we came out of the elevator, the whole ceiling was busted and gushing water. The fire guy who was sweeping the water just said "walk around it"! When we got back from our outing, the ground was still wet downstairs. When we went up to our penthouse room, it was like entering a volcano. It was HOT! When we got to our room, it maintained a cool temperature so it was not overly uncomfortable. We had purchased so many stuff that moving to another room was not an option, although we were only given an option when we asked! No one ever called us to say the AC was down, we're sorry for the inconvenience, what can we do to assist you to make you feel more comfortable, we are working on the problem .. NOTHING!! We decided to ignore it as best as possible since it was only a 4 day stay. The phone was covered in dirt this time, we had to clean and sanitize before we used it, and the carpets were spotted. We left on our last day, and the AC still was not fixed properly. Upon checkout, we still did not even receive an apology. Only stay at this hotel if you need a place to sleep, don't go there thinking its a home away from home because you do not get that treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: johncon68
Reviews.Content: I have been coming once per month to this hotel for over a year now. The free shuttle picks me up at Miami Airport, and takes me back at the end of my week stay. The staff is great and food at restaurant excellent. I don't know how an italian cheff does such a great job with jerk chicken, but he does. The happy hour 2 for 1 lobby bar from 5 to 7 PM is really happy. The rooms are spacious, clean and have excellent views. Shuttle to mall a few blocks away, and restaurants all around. Pool is cool especially in summer months. Free covered parking. I highly recommend this hotel, value for money is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Area”
Reviews.Author: havlyn
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for years. The hotel room is ok, has everything you would need. Check in was very simple. There is a $100.00 deposit require at checkin which is normally refunded on check out. It is very conviently located across the road from West Land Mall and in a shopping area with lots of restaurants including Chilli's and Red Lobster. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: correah1
Reviews.Content: I stay for a post cruise, after a wonderful vac, we end at this misery hotel. Need an update now, it smell mold at all corners, the room was dirty and dusty. The AC was not working and it smell like a sick building. We went to front desk for help, they change our room, but guess what, the problem was not the room it was the whole hotel. The new room smell the same, the AC was bad, the dust was terrible. We end sick the other day and checkout immediately. I still congested due to the dust on that place. I book this hotel through hotwire mystery hotel program and it was sold like a 3* but it is really a near 0.5*. If you see this hotel at your booking make sure to change it before getting there or you may be disappointed. This is the best I can do to save other vacs.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here--dirty, smelly, bed bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gumpswife
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights. Huge mistake. Got bit by bedbugs. Beds uncomfortable. Few speak English. Dirty, smelly hallways. There was a chicken wing that stayed on the floor outside near my room for 2 days before it was vacuumed. Close to highways but far from everything else. I will not ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend stay! Ignore the bizarre negative reviews below.”
Reviews.Author: BGIWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews below, I must ask if these individuals stayed at the same hotel I stayed at? Iâ€™ve just returned from a relaxing three night stay at this wonderful property booked via AA Hotels. When I landed in Miami at 16:30, I called the hotel to ask what time the next shuttle was, they said 17:00â€¦. It arrived at 17:05. I was warmly welcomed on arrival and within five minutes I had my room key and was in the elevator to my room (324) on the third floor. The room was very spacious and had all the amenities I could ask for, fast & reliable wireless internet, television with about 30 premium cable channels, coffee maker with tea and coffee sachets, air conditioning etc. There is a restaurant onsite but I never used it as I preferred to go to the restaurants at the nearby Westfield Mall such as IHOP and Chillis. The bathroom is also quite spacious and MOULD FREE. It's comprised of a show/bath combination and even has a hair-dryer. There is ample wardrobe space as well as an in-room safe. Not once I did I encounter a stained carpet, mould anywhere in my room, cigarette scents, rude staff, dubious credit card charges or a late shuttle. If anyone below who is complaining had bothered to check, they wouldâ€™ve recognised that the shuttle service goes to the airport, the mall and the nearby Walmart to accommodate guests who have stayed their primarily to shop. There is a shuttle schedule at the front desk and as I wisely did, they should have called the hotel to find out the pick-up times from MIA before waiting an inordinate amount of time for it to arrive. I myself took the shuttle to Walmart the Saturday morning at 10:00, and it returned promptly at 14:00. What I loved about the reliable shuttle service is that I was able to take it to MIA the Sunday, and then catch the 150 Airport Flyer Bus to South Beach thereby saving a bundle. Even on that day, the shuttle was on time in departure and its return the night. It is clear to me that empty vessels indeed make the most noise. Overall, if youâ€™re looking for affordable accommodation, near a shopping area with an efficient shuttle service to and from the airport and shopping centre, Howard Johnson is it. Even if your just overnighting in Miami itâ€™s an excellent optionâ€¦ the hotel is just 25 minutes from the airport and much cheaper than the other so-called airport hotels. I paid $62 USD a night. The only reason Iâ€™m not giving the hotel five stars is because I didnâ€™t get the 8th floor room I asked for weeks in advance and some of the staff needed to smile a bit more. Nevertheless, I will be staying here on my next trip to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: wzjpkp
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous and friendly that I will admit and I do miss having fun with them in the bar. HOWEVER NEVER GIVE THIS HOTEL A CREDIT OR DEBIT CARD NUMBER TO CHECK IN!. I cant stress this enough...due to ridiculous internal accounting situations I was charged nearly 500 TWICE in one day..and of course they say OH that will come off in 10 days or so..NOT..I had two 'holds' on my debit to the tune of nearly 600 that stayed for more than 30 days..even after I contacted the Hotel Manager and his accountant they ignored my emails and calls..PAY CASH...or suffer the consequences..

Reviews.Title: “Never again! We packed up & moved to another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OliveTraveling
Reviews.Content: I admit I was skeptical about my reservation from the start but I was going to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt. Big mistake. We arrived around 9pm on 4/7/11. The desk agent claimed that we had the last room available. The plus is that the hotel lobby is very inviting but that is about it. In our reservation we noted that there was a breastfeeding mom and we needed a refrigerator and that I was highly allergic to mold. The agent acknowledged our request but we NEVER received a refrigerator and later told us that it was first come first serve. From the moment we got off the elevator we knew we wouldn't enjoy our stay. There was a very weird & musty smell on our floor. The hallway carperts were visibly stained as well as the CURTAINS in our room. Clearly there were no renovations to this floor. The bathroom reminded you of those "passing through" motels. However, the worst was the visible mold in the bathroom, on the wall, and windows. I began swelling within ten minutes of entering the room. We contacted the front desk, explained our concern about the refrigerator to store the breastmilk and the mold. His response was "You are going to have to get some ice on the other floor and sorry there are no more rooms. You can go to the Ramada Inn." (Note: he remained pleasant) However, this was now after midnight! Needless to say, we never got the refrigerator, I couldn't take the mold anymore so the next morn, we packed up & checked out. We left in our pajamas because we didn't want to shower in that bathroom. We ended up at the Courtyard @ Mariott Flagler Station, a brand new hotel for the same price, 10 minutes down the road. Best move ever!

Reviews.Title: “"HATED IT".......TWO SNAPS AND A TWIST!!!!!!!!! MIAMI SHOULD BAN THIS HOTEL FROM THE RESORT AREA...!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmina77
Reviews.Content: Okay, this was suppose to be a great vacation break for myself and partner....Arrived in Miami on time and without any hitch with our airlines. I thought that would be our biggest dilema trying to get to Miami....but no we made it with no problems, even arrived early to make sure we made it on time or before the time of check in which was 1:45pm and check in time was 3:00pm. 1:55pm-Called to asked the time of shuttle pick at Miami International Airport. Was told shuttle driver is on his way, time moved on it was 2:30pm now, we were like okay it could be conjested on the way to the airport, 3:15pm came and we were like okay lets call to make sure we were standing in the correct spot for shuttle.....front desk person states "okay I will send the shuttle now.....so I was like you are just now sending the shuttle when I called almost an hour ago!.....So I asked what color is the shuttle van cause I'm not familiar with the HOJo shuttle scheme....so he yells "blue and white".......I was like no you did not yell!!.....he hangs up, so now its like 3:45pm and still no shuttle, there are other people standing near us and we watch several other hotel chain shuttles go pass us several times (I mean like the Marriott went pass 4 times, Doubletree 5 times, Sofitel 3 times......and so on and so on) No blue and white HOJo.....we call again and the guy has a nerve to say well the shuttle is leaving now and he has to make a stop at "Walmart"......We did not want to hear about him going to Walmart!!!!.....when we been waiting for pick up to check in and try to enjoy the rest of our evening in Miami it really through off extra plans we had when we arrived in Miami!!!!!......this all said we did not get to check into our room until after 4pm almost 5pm and was starving from waiting in the lines to check in for rooms cause they had new hires at there front desk.......they knew they were overbooked and could not handle the crowd also the hotel manager was no where to be found the hotel concierge was not even helpful trying to make excuses for the reason they sent the shuttle driver to "Walmart" instead of picking up some of the guest who had already prepaid for the rooms!!!!.......Never Ever Ever will HOJo get my money or my family/friends nor enermies the Worst!!!

Reviews.Title: “All about Rene”
Reviews.Author: bajanmich
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every year, the front office staff are horrible and never know anything they dont even bother to look at you when they are speaking to you. But what really makes my holiday is Rene, he is amazing and while speaking to my fellow bajans we all agree that he makes that hotel you get good assistance from Morice as well, I hope Rene is always there.

Reviews.Title: “Limo from Airport to hotel never came, but they assured us it was "on the way"”
Reviews.Author: issinmaine
Reviews.Content: You know what its like after arriving to MIA after a late flight and waiting for the shuttles that constantly comes from other area hotels. Well we were waiting for HoJos to arrive, and waiting and calling and were told "it'll be there in 30mins, waiting and calling and hearing "he just left" and waiting and calling, "20mins" and finally giving up and shelling out 40.00 to a cab at 11pm. Coming in to the lobby to find an unapologetic front desk man who shoves the limo itinerary in your face. That's class for a 3star isn't it? Never again.Oh and don't believe the map on line, its a lot further from the airport than they indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Howard Johnsons' Always Deliver Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Caribbeanmomof2
Reviews.Content: After reading pretty average reviews on Expedia.com I was pretty worried. However, when we actually stayed there for 4 nights with a 18 month old prior to our cruise I was more than satisfied. It was nice, clean, comfy and I have absolutely no complaints. People complain for the most silly reasons. The carpets were clean and free parking was a joy! Front desk checked us in promptly and the guy was very customer-service oriented. I truly don't understand how people go there thinking Ritz-Carlton. It's a Howard Johnson Hotel people, it does exactly what it promises on, comfort and convenience above everything else. So if you expect 5 stars then go stay in a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: nancyreb
Reviews.Content: Our party of four booked a room here for the night before we began a cruise from Miami. Our travel agent booked us the "penthouse two doubles nonsmoking" for an advance purchase of $159.00. We arrived at the hotel that evening around 10 PM. At the counter we were told that the room was not available; that the only thing available was a double smoking room. The clerk told us there were "computer problems" with rooms booked through Expedia. We repeatedly told her that we had not booked our room through Expedia, but it made no difference. We also asked to speak to the manager several times, but he was not on site and the clerk would not call him. The clerk offered us the smoking double room. I asked the rate that would be charged to someone off the street and she told me $89. The hotel would not give us a credit for the difference between the costs or give us two rooms even though we had prepaid $159. Our travel agent is currently working to resolve the money issue. Because it was late and were staying for only one night we took the smoking double room. Others standing in line also did not have their resevations honored. I spoke to several people who did not receive what they had reserved and they also did not book through Expedia. The room was very dirty. It did not look like the carpet had been vacuumed in awhile. Also, the blanket (not the bedspread) felt like rubber. Finally, while the hotel is advertised as the "Miami Airport" Howard Johnson's it is not close at all. It is advertised as 5.7 miles from the airport. This is "as the crow flies" and not the miles you drive. It is more like 11 miles from the airport. We were later told that it is the nearest Howard Johnson to the airport, hence the name.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mazzuk
Reviews.Content: I just spent 20 days in this hotel during my stay in Miami for a lot of business meetings, I stayed in this HOJO many times in the past years, and I have never had problems, rooms are clean and confortable, wi - fi is not so fast, however nothing particular bad ! Only this year I had a problem during my stay, they made a mess with my credit card calling me in the night reporting me the same problem I solved in the morning with the froint desk manager on duty . I reported this mess to the general manager, and he didnt't take care of my matter ! This is not the way to take care of a customer who spends more than 20 days in your hotel, umbelivable .

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Shalana
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with one of those expedia deals, where they sell off rooms at extremely discounted rates. All I wanted was a free shuttle to and from the airport, a hot shower, and a bed to sleep in. I arrived in Miami at 10:30 pm and had to be back at the airport for 6 am. Getting the shuttle wasn't too difficult, once I got through! But they don't have a direct line from the airport, so I had to pay. The shuttle arrived in 20 minutes, as predicted. The troubles began when I got to the hotel. First I was told they had no rooms with double beds, did I mind having a king? Then I was told they had no rooms period. Then I was told they only had smoking rooms, and would that be ok? I said no! That would not be ok! And they just shrugged and said well it's all we have. They pretty much have me in a bind, since I already paid and it's nearing midnight now. So I took the room... it smelled awful! I had an immediate headache! Slept terrible due to the smell. And come the morning, their shuttle doesn't start until 6! So I had to pay $30 for a taxi!! Grrrr.... basically ended up spending the $100 it would have cost me full price for a better night!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: daj0201
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, the 15th and 16th. Housekeeping does not vaccuum the rooms, found slippers, socks, and charger under the bed. Blankets are very old, bahtroom floor very dirty and there were two roaches in the bathroom. Called front desk twice to ask for a toothbrush but never it was never delivered. For the price of this hotel it's not worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Search for hotel elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: anem65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 15 - 20 minutes from the airport. Not sure why they even call it an airport hotel. My other concern about this hotel, was the noise level. It was hard to sleep listening to the traffic all night long. The hotel should consider replacement windows....ones that are more soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a small budget, but no frills!”
Reviews.Author: howardxp1
Reviews.Content: This should NOT be rated a 3 star hotel. It's a 2 star hotel to any seasoned traveler. The price was very cheap which is the only strong point it has going for it. If you want a refrigerator in your room, it's an extra $10 per day! There are no microwaves in the rooms. Also, the room safes were not functioning in any of the rooms in the hotel. There are no temperature controls in any rooms and if you want to use the single computer in the "business center" downstairs, then you must pay hourly. Worst of all were the blankets. They felt like they were made out of recycled plastic soda containers! Extremely lightweight and felt like sandpaper! No joking. Blankets like that are disgusting and should disqualify Howard Johnson's from even trying to be a 3 star hotel. Lastly, no breakfast at all in included. All the 2 1/2 star hotels i use have all the above amenities that this hotel did NOT have. The price was low, but you get what you pay for i suppose in this case. One more thing. I received 2 faxes on 2 separate days. Each time, they misplaced them and i never got them!

Reviews.Title: “They could not do more for me and my clients”
Reviews.Author: andycooney
Reviews.Content: I booked 12 rooms in this hotel in November. We are all musicians performing on a Cruise out of Miami. They have a complimentary shuttle from the airport and a $15 shuttle to the Port of Miami. This worked out perfect for us. I had approximately 18 people coming in from many destinations. The snow storm in the North East hit which caused many flights to cancel. Needless to say I kept adjusting my reservations with the front desk. They were extremely patient with me. I do a lot of traveling and I must admit that I have never dealt with and more accommodating staff, especially the Front Desk Manager, Lorenzo. Besides the staff being so accommodating, it was a lovely place to stay. I was pleasantly surprised with how nice the hotel was for the great price we got. I will definitely be using this Hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT~”
Reviews.Author: Noreno
Reviews.Content: Hi I was here at Hojo from Jan 5-9 2011. We caught a good deal from Expedia. I stayed in the PH-17. The hotel staff was some what friendly can be better. I love that everyday our rooms were clean, beds were made, trash was gone and we had fresh new towels. What I don't like about the hotel is no free breakfast and if you dont have a rental car its kind of hard to get around in. The main big thing i love about this hotel is if you are a SHOPPER then this hotel is for you. Its located neat westland mall, target, walmart, fast food places, 20 mins to south beach. Book through expedia the best way to go. Would we stay again of course we will. The fitness center was always broke.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and attractive ammenities hotel located near airport !”
Reviews.Author: dexmarg
Reviews.Content: Great airport shuttle and hotel location - shuttle to and from Walmart and Westfield Mall daily ! Also located on bus route to other main shops : Marshalls, Walgreens, Kmart, ToysRus, Mens Wharehouse ect. The hotel has a onsite car rental if needed and you can get a cab too. Thanks to Rene' for ordering lunch for us ! The hotel restaurant serves breakfast from 7:30am and dinner from 5pm only - dinner daily special is decent and reasonable, Thanks Mariana! No microwave in most rooms. Simple hotel that service most needs including a beauty saloon !

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug”
Reviews.Author: kevin_wang55242
Reviews.Content: Room was ok until late night when we woke up to our bed swarming with bed bugs! They were everywhere! We were horrified to have such an experience you only hear about on t.v! Never going back there again!

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Murdocki
Reviews.Content: My experience was good, not excellent especially for the price offered. One of my biggest disappointment was the fact that for the 8 nights I stayed at the hotel only 2 days the WiFi was available, and this was free as part of the hotel package. I had to pay at the business office on the property to use the internet. The bad part that whenever I would enquired the young lady can never give a definite idea when it would be fixed. This was bad, in addition to the safe not working, apparently this has been so for months before my visit in July/August 2009...this was a disappointment. Despite these problems, the hotel experience was Good.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: missva24
Reviews.Content: Howard Johnson airport plaza hotel is one of worst hotels ever made first off they are no where close to the airport they are 30mins away ,they say that they have refrigerators and microwaves on the website but when you show up they say that you have to request one and that it is $10 extra , since there was no more refrigerators and microwaves available and no customer lounge in order to heat up food I had to go to the front desk and wait for them to stop ignoring me so that they can warm up my food and at times they was very rude and snotty about it and directed me to the restaurant who refused to warm up my food and was even ruder then the people at the front desk .when my boyfriend and I asked for directions somewhere they had no idea how to get anywhere and was uninterested in help us find out how to get here ,and when we called up the local transportation the reaction was the same. Most of the people we come into contact with all over Miami was stuck up ,snobby and had no knowledge of anything ,the airport shuttle driver made it his point to make me late for the last flight of the day and I ended up spending 12hours in the airport along with 50-100 other people including young children and disabled people . And the hotel along with the people at the airport did not care and charged me an extra $130 for the flight and $25 for my bag laughed in my face and had awful attitude ,and it was my birthday vacation/ charismas gift to go to Miami and the hotel and the people treated me like trash .

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: Simonlens
Reviews.Content: Just finished our honeymoon last week, lived here in Nov. The location is good, right next to Rt826, even it's a little far from airport, but can reach within 15-20min. Price is good through here, but room has a smell. The cheapostay saying that there is FREE breakfast, but when we arrived. The hotel said our room was booked through expedia(I don't know what happened.) and NO FREE breakfast provided for us. And we need to pay $9.xx for the breakfast. So we need to buy food outside. :(

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: lapitraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before we rented our car for the next week to go to the Keys. We thought it would be convenient as it seemed close fo the airport and had a free airport shuttle. Well... we waited almost an hour for the shuttle bus and when we called the hotel and the front desk girl named Liz answered, she was very rude. and unhelpful. Just as she was when we finally were checking in. The shuttle took almost 30 mins to get to the hotel from the airport! That is how long it took us to drive to South Beach once we got our rental!!!! We got to our room and there was a cockroach crawling on the wall!We were on the 6th floor! We wanted to go the gym but it was not available- shut down for some reason. We looked to see if there was anywhere to walk around outside the hotel- nothing safe, just freeways around, a shady cuban bar and immigration places. Nothing to do around the hotel. At night, we had difficulty sleeping with all the noise and light from the hallway since our door seal was not proper and light was coming in all around. The room was supposed to be non smoking but smelt like smoke. The driver of the shuttle bus, swimming pool and the restaurant were the only decent things.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, fantastic, caring, kind staff who make you feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: ismeliz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Johnson Hotel in Miami from Wednesday 17th to Sunday 21st November. I have been to the Hotel many times in the last 5 years and I keep coming back because of the caring staff, great location for shopping and the shuttle service which comes to Miami Airport almost every hour to pick up and drop guests who stay at the hotel. The room was always nice and clean and I had sent emails to Mr. Roberto Negretti the Director of Sales before flying to Miami and he answered my emails very quickly. One morning I was having breakfast and I saw Mr. Negretti waiting on tables, getting juice etc for people and helping out everywhere. I spoke to him and he remembered me from my emails. I asked him what he was doing there and he said he and another guy from the Sales department were helping out in the restaurant that morning. I couldn't believe what I was seeing. He was so nice and caring to everyone and a big asset to the hotel. The last day I was shopping in the Mall and someone stole my handbag which was unfortunate but these things happen in life. Mr Lorenzo Olmedo the Front Office Manager was a godsend. He went out of his way to help me and I have to say I dont know what the Hotel will do if he was to leave as he was truly a good, kind and caring person. I am looking forward to returning to the hotel next year mainly because of the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD”
Reviews.Author: anoerita
Reviews.Content: It's the perfect place to stay. Great location in the heart of the HIALEAH shopping center. The service at the Hotel was great! Thank U HOWARD JOHNSON Crew!!!

Reviews.Title: “GOD Bless Staff At H.J Hialeah Gardens”
Reviews.Author: Rules_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location for pleasure, shopping & business. My room was clean, the staff executes first class service from the drivers, bellmen, front desk, activities desk, house keepers all the staff. Manny, Maurice, Aziz, Carlos & Aurelia just to name a few excellent customer service from them. I never had any issues whatsoever with this hotel Praise Jesus. Great for families as well.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located - dining, shopping”
Reviews.Author: Gleaned
Reviews.Content: My experience was not a bad one - the main issue was having to wait close to 2 hours for the airport shuttle. My advice to the hotel management - improve that service and you will get more clients. Other than this, the stay was comfortable, the rooms were clean. The proximity to shopping and dining areas is a plus as well as having a shipping department on the 2nd floor, should one need to purchase bulk items that cannot fit in luggage. Many thanks to Ernesto and Rene for their great assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money spent”
Reviews.Author: janicem43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is big on customer service and the location is perfect.The belman service and free shuttles is a big plus for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraceSouthAmerica
Reviews.Content: HoJo is a nice hotel and we especially want to thank Renee from front desk for his excellent service during our stay there. Renee you are the best!!! Further we want to thank the bellman: Erel Morice, Ernesto and Rene for their excellent service day by day! Thnaks so much. Of course we can not forget Juan from the car rental!! Juan thanks for your wonderful service whenever we are at HoJo. The only thing we want to complain about is that the hotel needs to have some rules now. Some guests behave very badly and that is not good for the name of the hotel. Walking on bare feet, be at the front desk in pyama's...no I don't think this is what HoJo deserves. Further I have no complaints and as we tay in this hotel for years, we will continue to do so. Very best regards, Grace and family

Reviews.Title: “My Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: HelenTrinidad1948
Reviews.Content: I am a very satisfied customer. I always look forward to staying here. All your employees are very helpful. However, special mention should be made of Rene and Luz.Please DO NOT LOSE THESE VALUABLE EMPLOYEES. They ensure that all my needs are met during my stay. Thanks very much. Helen Balroop Very satisfied customer

Reviews.Title: “I GO WITH HOJO MIAMI EVERYTIME”
Reviews.Author: MiamiFan57
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel from the Park Plaza, Miami Plaza era and it has gotten better with every stay. Howard Johnson continues to improve with every visit and I would recommend it to anyone especially if you like to shop. Just imagine I declined my company's offer to stay at the Miami Airport and the Hyatt downtown and opted for the Howard Johnson. The front office Manager Lorenzo is outstanding, delivers brilliant customer service, efficicient, accomodating, flexible and understanding,great interaction with all guests and I look forward to the warm friendly greeting by Maurice and the other "bell man" team. As a frequent traveller from Barbados, this will remain my first choice for accomodation whenever I visit Miami. Surely, it has some issues, but which hotel doesn't

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Fruttiveg
Reviews.Content: A traditional airport hotel with truly outstanding service. If you need assistance ask for Gibel, who normally works back office. If you need help ask for Renee. We did not have any problems, they were just exceptional: welcoming, pleasant, and thoughtful. A perfect place to stay if you are driving to Miami and leaving your car before flying to another city. A scheduled shuttle to the Airport and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, food poor, shuttle service terrible”
Reviews.Author: Pinkipink
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night before going on a cruise, and wouldn't have stayed any longer. Waited two hours for the shuttle bus, it didn't turn up so had to pay for a taxi instead, which wasn't cheap. Room was OK and bed comfortable. Food in restaurant all seemed to be overcooked. Reception staff were miserable and put the phone down on us when we rang with a query. Not the best start to a holiday really.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: bosajoc
Reviews.Content: When I made my reservation, I was looking for a good price hotel with airport shuttle and a good location (near a mall & a BestBuy). Then, I read some reviews that wasn't too nice... But they were wrong. The employees are very nice, the shuttle drivers (Manny & Carlos) were very helpful explaining me how to get to the mall and were to go. the rooms are very good!, the bed is amazing, I slept like a baby. The pool is beautiful and the restaurant is preaty good. I HATE cigarettes smoke, and my room was very cigarettes FREE, that was cool! Botom line: Very good hotel, amazing people and bed!, and its under 80 bucks!!!!! What I liked: The staff, the bed, and Manny, who took me to BestBuy so I didn't have to walk i the hot Miami weather. What I didn't like: I had to wait for a little more than an hour in the airport for the shuttle, but it's UNDERSTANDABLE considering the traffic and the 25 min. trip from the airport to the hotel and vice versa

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kaka009
Reviews.Content: I liked the pool and the spa. The Front Office Manager Lorenzo was very helpfull and quick in taking decisions. Liked it. Rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at the Howard Johnson Plaza Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: chestnuttpg
Reviews.Content: I thought it necessary to contact you to inform you of our recent stay at the Howard Johnson Plaza Hotel Miami Airport and what a wonderful time we had. My daughter, sister and mother accompanied me and we all enjoyed our stay. We were visiting for the first time from Barbados and the time went by so quickly. Before we knew it, it was time to return home. It is my hope that you and your friendly staff will continue to keep up the good work and we are already planning to visit again next year. Thank you for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “" Go for it ~ You wont regret it ! "”
Reviews.Author: Nishika
Reviews.Content: We just got back home from our stay at this hotel in Miami, we went to this hotel with very little expectations after reading alot of bad reviews but our trip at this hotel was a pleasant surprise, everything was great but got to mention that it was excellent value for your money, especially with the free shuttle from the airport and the shopping malls. The shuttle driver Mr. Celso although undertands and talks very little english but is excellent with his service and went an extra mile to make our stay very comfortable and next time we are in Miami we will surely be going back to Howard Johnson.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Personnel”
Reviews.Author: funnygirlpart2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for awhile. While it shows its age, all I needed was a place to sleep, a hot shower and friendly people. I got all that I needed. The value is outstanding, the location and that the guests turned out to be very diverse was another plus. Morice, one of the bellmen was always helpful, all of the bellmen I should say always went out of their way to help, even when I did not ask. One problem is it is next to a school so sometimes it was difficult to get out on the road, but when I figured out which way to go all was fine. Just ask the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience from the start to the finish”
Reviews.Author: americanqueen
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner chose this hotel because of the convenient location. When we got to the airport we waited for over 2 hours and no shuttle showed up and then upon calling the hotel they said the shuttle was on the way and we kept calling and got an attitude. Upon arrival at the hotel in a taxi the manager and front desk staff was quite disrespectful an unapologetic. The second night of our stay at the hotel bed bugs attacked us thank God we were leaving in the morning we had bed bugs bites all over we would never staythere again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here five hours to have a place to...”
Reviews.Author: Leong's
Reviews.Content: Stayed here five hours to have a place to rest after a cruise and before a flight out of Miami. Beds were very comfortable and clean. We were able to checkin immediately at 10 am and only paid 58 dollars for two double beds. Free shuttle service to airport was nice since it costs about 45 dollars from port to hotel. Hotel restaurant was not open but I grabbed snacks from the sundry store in the hotel. For price and closeness to airport I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “IMPOSSIBLE TO CONTACT”
Reviews.Author: privateislands
Reviews.Content: One would assume an airport hotel would have a shutle service. Seems this one does but if you want to try to arrange a collection you better speak Spanish and be willing to call at least four times. Seems this hotel loves to hang up on callers - or was it just me?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel i would recommend”
Reviews.Author: KaylaAdelle
Reviews.Content: the Howard Johnson hotel,Miami. the hotel service was excellent.the housekeeper made sure to clean the room when we were not there and the conceirge/tour opperater was very pleasant and the shuttle service was great but he was sometimes late but othkn erwise the service was great.I would reccomend this hotel i had a great stay ,now it's time to talk about the resturant the food wasn't that good but it was ok and that is my review

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but some rude front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: HoJoDisappointee
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Howard Johnson last week. This was my second time there. The first time was in August 2009. I had no problems on that trip. Howard Johnson now offers just two continental breakfast tickets per room for each day of your stay. When we arrived we were short on the coupons but did not bother to say anything at the time because we did not think it would be a problem to come back when we were ready and get the extra ticket. I went to the front desk and told the lady we were short one and she told me that it was impossible. I did not know it was impossible for humans to make mistakes, but in other words I was made to look like an idiot. She told me to wait a while until she finished off some paper work that was in her hands. I waited a few seconds then another front desk employee asked my concern. I told him I was waiting until the other lady was through because I thought she was going to take care of the situation and hand me another coupon. but then she says to me, 'you need to tell him". I felt like I was being tossed around. I explain the situation again to whom I perceived to be the supervisor and low to my surprise he told me that I was wrong that I got the correct amount of coupons and that I was not short. Now I was being made to look like a liar. I was highly upset because this man was not even on the desk when we first arrived. He just took her side and refused to give me another coupon. We got in a heated argument, yes that's right, he argued with me word for word and even told me to shut up and said that I was stupid also, when I told him he was stupid. I have a degree in Professional management and what I experienced with Howard Johnson front desk staff was very poor customer service. You should never argue with your customer. The continental breakfast was only, tea, juice, a small cup of fruits and a pastry. I asked him, why would I lie for a cup of tea. I told him I was not coming back to that hotel and he said, 'good'. Even if the hotel has a strict policy on the amount of coupons they give out they should allow for short comings as in my case. I would of gladly signed a note to say I received an 'extra' coupon. In fact as a supervisor/manager there are times when all the rules are not laid down in the books and you have to be able to make decisions on your feet. Do you loose a customer and possibly more for me posting this bad experience or do you just go ahead and try to keep a happy customer. the next day I went to use the internet service and the printers were not functioning. The guy at the internet desk was nice enough to allow me to use it free of charge just because he knew that I was not able to print anything. I still offered to pay when I was done but he did not accept it, for this I was able to enjoy the rest of my stay at Howard Johnson but I can't say that I will return. Other than that it is a nice hotel. This was on the morning of August 12th. I am writing Howard Johnson and letting them know of this rude service and I hope that these two are reprimanded for the sake of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can!”
Reviews.Author: bork3000
Reviews.Content: Two words: BED BUGS! Big ones, and the bites itch like hell! I had to leave after 2 days of what was supposed to be a 5 day (prepaid!) stay because, frankly, no amount of money is worth being bitten and finding dead bed bugs in your sheets! This place is unsanitary and needs to be shut down for total fumigation (or better yet - razed). Elevators and hallways were dirty (including at one point a puddle of what looked like urine in the elevator). Restaurant breakfast in the morning would be nice but I waited for 20 minutes to have someone come up and take my order, and finally left without one. I wish I could get my money back - that'll learn me not to "prepay" a hotel stay online.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: DianaNJ123
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible hotel experience and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The penthouse room was infested with ants, including the balcony and bathroom. We made a request with the front desk staff to fumigate the room and had to rent in another hotel while they took cared of the situation. When we returned the ants were still all over. The second room also had alot of ants and the toilet was clogged - from the previous guest who most likely did not report the problem. We called the front desk, went downstairs, and called a few more times wondering if they forgot about us since they had us waiting for over an hour. Finally a young security guard showed up with a plunger stating "well this is not my job". We were so upset that we told him to forget about it. We then packed and was ready to check out when the staff finally decided to offer us a another room. They should have had thought about that when the complaint was done and not had us there waiting for a security guard to fix the toilet. We are highly dissatisfied and will not ever stay there. It was not fun having the ants attacking us in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual and would never stay anywhere else but Howard Johnson Plaza when i'm in Miami..”
Reviews.Author: lwk777
Reviews.Content: With the exception of a few minor hick ups with the room, we throughly enjoyed our stay as usual. Juan down stairs in the car rental was always there to assist in every way. Staff were as usual friendly and are always willing to assist you, especially the bellmen. It was raining one day and those guys went all out to make sure we didn't get wet, they helped us get our bags from shopping out the vehicle in quick time, you gotta give props to Maurice and those Guys. They always make you feel welcome and always give you the 5 star treatment. Keep up the good work guys and see you in a few months again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: britonpaul
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was great. Armondo Hernandez and Lorenzo Olmedo(managers) were helpful and extremely friendly.The maid staff did a great job during our five day stay. We would definitely stay there again.It is a beautiful hotel with everything you need right there(pool,restaurant,gift shop).We were in town for the University of Miami's graduation and it was only 20 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “i would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashley2230
Reviews.Content: i would not recommend this place, most of the things did not work, the front desk lady was no help, most of the staff did not speak english, if i needed assistance i had to figure it out myself thanks for no service. the restaurant at the hotel was even worst, went there one night he said it was not open,

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TriniTourist
Reviews.Content: When I visited this hotel, rennovations were in progress so that may have tampered with the experience of the hotel but even so the hotel was good. Front Desk Staff: Really helpfull and courteous 5/5 Maids: By the far the mostly friendly maids ever! 5/5 Restaurant: Can be better 3.5/5 Hotel Room: Have always been clean except for my last trip, it had some cockroaches but that was solely due to the rennovations 3.5/5 Pool: 5/5 Gift Shop: Can be better 3.5/5 Fitness Centre: 4/5 Spa: 3.5/5 Overall: Good Hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “NEVER NEVER NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Dogmommie2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the HoJo Plaza, Hialeah hotel for 3 nights. The first afternoon, my daughter tried calling the hotel for 4 hours,. Their phone system was mal functioning. She finally got hold of the Restuarant, they were very very very UNcooperative in notifying the Front Desk that there was something wrong with the phone system. My daughter called HoJo Reservations and was put on hold when explaining the situation. She held on for about 15 minutes and hung up. I tried to call her also from my room at the HoJo, but couldn't get an outside line, I went downstairs to let the Front Desk know and they finally sent someone up after 2 hours. My daughter also got a hold of 'Pete' in Sales and told him that she was trying to reach her parents and couldn't get a hold of the Front Desk, he didn't care and was very rude and transferred her right back to the malfunctioning phone system. Another friend tried to call us and was hung up by the Front Desk twice. My room was not cleaned the next day, I called Housekeeping and asked for clean towels, they didn't have any. My room was not cleaned the 2nd day when I returned after 9:30 p.m., I called the Front Desk, they would make a note of it. I asked for extra toilet paper, no one brought us any. Their 'complimentary breakfast' consists of 2 boxes of ceareal and some milk. You have to pay extra for bread. I am very unimpressed with this hotel. The loud music that comes from the conference rooms is heard all over the hotel. I will let all my friends and business partners in the Caribbean know to stay somewhere else. I am very annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal for your money.”
Reviews.Author: HOOTLOOP
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel, which went ok, we were there during some renovations but it did not bother us. The hotel in general was clean and cool and very attractive, in the lobby area. We requested a smoking room. When we entered the room the room had a very stong odor of old smoke. It was so bad we had to have a room change. The nights was quite uncomfortable, this was due to to lumpy mattress on the bed, some areas on the bed sunk way in , it was like lying in a whole and other parts was like lying on a mountain. The bathroom was cleaned on a daily basis, but the floor tiles was old and needed to be upgraded. The AC worked some of the time and other times we were very warm. The continental breakfast was a joke, not many options to choose from. The restuarant was under renovations and we had no choice but to seek food on the outside, no room service available, so this really had an impact on our vacation mode. When we checked out we made reference to the mattress and I hope that they have made changes. We are planning to return to the hotel soon. There are alot of shopping places around and the free parking is great. The staff was very friendly, hopefully they have gotten themselves together by now. Eveyone deserves a second chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, clean, need a car for getting around”
Reviews.Author: LondonUK2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. It's convenient for the airport and as a spring board for seeing Miami. Some nice extras - free shuttle to/from airport, tea & coffee making facilites in the room. Although it's not far from Miami Beach, unless you're staying only a short time you need a car to get around. There is an Enterprise car rental service pretty much over the road as well as a rental service within the hotel. Hotel staff are pleasant, friendly and willing to help, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hojo”
Reviews.Author: Ericb88
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the lobby, throughout your stay, you will not believe you are at a Howard Johnsons

Reviews.Title: “Beat my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ericb88
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest Howard Johnsons I've been in. Fantastic renovations, very friendly staff, located near all of the Miami hotspots

Reviews.Title: “Terrible night”
Reviews.Author: RogerDodgerHouston
Reviews.Content: Encouraged when we pulled up to the place and checked in. Rooms were average at best. Little did we know there was a Spring Break Party scheduled. The entire Hip Hop Nation was there, boom bass and all. Riot police, sirens, car alarms and arrests in the parking lot. All night. Wanted to use the business center to print my boarding pass - $1 for every ten minutes of computer time. Are you kidding me?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: caribbeanJaz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week. The hotel location was ideal for our purpose, which was shopping. We were able to have our stuff picked up from our room by the shippers. The hotel is located along a very busy highway so there is some noise and you will need to be careful when crossing the road. The plus side to that is that everything is closeby (walking and driving) There was an extremly helpful doorman called Maurice and the front desk was generally helpful although laid back at times. The cleanliness of the room could do with some improvement especially in the 'hidden' areas. I will nevertheless recommend this hotel - and I have- I also plan to return in July. I have stayed in another hotel nearby and Howard Johnson definitely infar better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Obviously the state prison didnâ€™t have any vacancies.”
Reviews.Author: NTAVTR
Reviews.Content: When we were stranded overnight in Miami and needed a hotel close to the airport, we thought â€œHoward Johnsonâ€™sâ€”why not? Havenâ€™t stayed at one since we were kids!â€� Big mistakeâ€”this isnâ€™t the HoJoâ€™s we knew and loved (fried clams and ice cream, anyone?). Let's start with the free shuttle. It runs every TWO hours and if the driver doesn't see you standing outside MIA (since the driver was traveling at 70 mph around the airport, he won't) youâ€™re spending most of your day at the airport. Your next option is to take a cab. The airport is 11 MILES AWAY (remember, they call themselves an airport hotel) which equates to a 45 minute cab ride (there will be traffic) which will run you $35. No extra charge for the cab driverâ€™s extra-loud musical choices (he wonâ€™t understand English so donâ€™t waste your time telling to turn down the volume). Check in: Here is their scam. I watched as 6 different people attempted to check in and each one was told that the hotel could not honor their original rate given by Howard Johnson (because you did not call this specific hotel directly) and that their original rate increased by $20.00. Every person, regardless of their quoted rate ($79, $89...) had their rate increased by $20. My wife called their bluff and informed the employee we were paying the original rate and that it was not open for discussion. We received a stranded passenger voucher from American Airlines for $69. After we asked to see the manager, the front desk employee quickly agreed to the $69 rate. She then attempted to appease us by reassigning us from the 2nd floor to the â€œpenthouseâ€� (It should be renamed the outhouse). The room was simply old, stained, dirty and depressing. Someone previously mentioned the hotel is conveniently located on the Palmetto Expressway-they are absolutely correct. Hojo will provide you with a truly memorable experience: You will actually feel like youâ€™re sleeping on the inside lane of the adjacent highway. Whether itâ€™s the â€œquick financial transactionsâ€� in the hallways or the tranquil screams from the carjacking that occurred across the street at the Traffic School (if you grew up in Baghdad, youâ€™ll love the neighborhood), there is something for the entire family. If you have an early flight to catch, youâ€™re in luck because the lack of hot water will ensure an invigorating cold shower. Bring plenty of cash; everything cost you at this Corrections facility.
