I truly expected Lynndie England to greet us at the front desk (complete with a Camel unfiltered hanging off her lip) to escort the family to our interrogation room. The Somalia coast line is safer than this place. You would get a better nightâ€™s rest at Boeingâ€™s Jet Engine Test plant. Sleep at the airport, sleep under a bridge, DO NOT TRY TO SLEEP HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What you pay for is what you get”
Reviews.Author: Irma_p13
Reviews.Content: From the outside it looks kinda of run down and crummy, once you step into the lobby it "looks" nice but the service was horrible. The young girl at the front was a complete airhead and it took us 30min to check in. Once we were up in the rooms, the carpet was pretty grimy and dirty, our remote didn't work, lamps didn't work etc. Spend the extra money and go somewhere nicer with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ramadaocr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has caring associates and they carry the true meaning of hospitality. Rooms were clean, lobby was nice, and staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, stinky and dirty!”
Reviews.Author: PattyLyca
Reviews.Content: Worst localization! Terrible service! Terrible food! If you get a lower floor, mainly in weekends, you won't get any sleep, once the restaurant, turns into a latin club after 10 pm, very, very loud music playing all night long. The room was stinky, the bed was awfully done, the bathroom floor dirt, with hairs on it. The hell in Miami. If you want to get the worst vacation ever, it seems to be a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Basic needs-not bad”
Reviews.Author: ARTaylor
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at this hotel due to a flight cancellation. I wanted to be close to the airport. The hotel is in a cluttered area with car lots & automotive repair shops. There's a garage to park your car, but it's not connected to the hotel, so if it rains, you're wet. There is plenty of parking around the hotel. I was there on a weeknight & didn't experience the "party crowd" that most complained about. There is a restaurant/club attached to the proberty, Ricks, and I'm sure it can get pretty rowdy on a good night. The lobby was nice & seemed to offer lots of amenities, rental car counter, tour counter, lounge bar, expanded gift shop & restaurant. My room was OK. Good size. Nothing scared me. No bugs, hair, gross looking stains, etc. but I could tell the place is a bit worn. I can't say that they're sweating the small details at this hotel. Little things that would keep me from feeling REALLY comfortable for more than 1 night...chipped decorative panels in the elevator, old & dirty window tracks, etc.. The bathroom was clean enough & could use some updating. There were a few places where the shower tile grout could use some attention, but nothing gross. The bedding was interesting. There were sheets & they were clean, but the blanket appeared to be some type of felt... like you use in arts & crafts. It smelled like fabric softner & gave me comfort that it had been cleaned. It was more tacky than anything. No blanket at all would have been better. The carpet was dark, but I could see some stains. Again, nothing gross, but showed the place was obviously lived in. Pictures on the website of the lobby, bar, standard King, & bathroom look exactly as mine did. Only you have examine a little closer to see the wear & tear on things. It looks like they've tried to do some updates on the cheap. Some things just didn't make sense though. There were huge gaps around the door frame & when the lights were out in the room, we got illumination from the hallway lights. Not very bright, but didn't need to turn on lights in the middle of the night. I prefer highter end hotels, but no problem going cheaper when needed. It worked for a short stay and I would recommend only for the same type of hotel need.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews....”
Reviews.Author: 1classydiva
Reviews.Content: Front Desk staff: the female staff members are NOT friendly at all. One decided to put me in an accessible room that smelled as if it had not been aired out in at least 6 months. Funny thing: when I called to complain, I got moved to another room that was perfect. Yet, she claimed the room I was in wasn't for the handicap, what with the bars in the bathroom, small sink, walk-in bath tub, and the openness of the room to accommodate a wheelchair. Yeah, right. The male front desk staff were totally awesome! The bell staff were amazing!!! They were extremely helpful in offering tips and suggestions...which is more than I can say for the CONCIERGE staff! They went out of their way to help me at every turn, and I really appreciate them, especialy Morice!!! He rocks! The restaurant was very nice! The bartender made sure I was taken care of, especially since I was traveling alone. Language barrier: it seems as if the primary language is NOT English. Beware of that. Overall, I am planning to stay there again with three rooms reserved for my daughter's high school graduation trip with my family in June.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay on back way from Port Canaveral”
Reviews.Author: sheoirse
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed good enough at the first sight, but from air condition I felt cigarette smoke. Also spares in the doors were quite wide, so I almost saw who is passing the door and could listen to anybody speaking in the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “gross hotel never will I stay in a HoJo again!!”
Reviews.Author: bloodhound01
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's not close to the airport....$30.00 cab ride to airport. Secondly it smelled bad and when I got home all my clothes smelled bad too! The blanket on the bed was sticky, plastic like and a relic from the 80's....they only give you two threadbare towels....we ordered chineese food and didn't have enough forks and they charged us a quarter for each plastic fork!!!!! Come on.....talk about cheap! One of the housecleaners actually opened our room door without even knocking!!! I will never stay at a HoJo again in my life....I would rather sleep on a chair in the airport!! Disgusting place!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: byebyejack
Reviews.Content: Very clean,confortable and great place to stay for the price, 20 min from all activity around Miami. Bad point Pool not heated and near the highway very noisy, but in Miami there is so much to do you go to your hotel to sleep so... Healeah is a funny district , unless you speak spanish,because allmost everybody is cuban there, but nice people!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money but Breakfast was a complete failure”
Reviews.Author: westwidetraveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were fine and location was good. But next day morning, at Breakfast, it was a complete failure. They try to serve you a packed breakfast like served on Airplane flights. We waited on the table for more than 20 mins before they gave us "pre packed" breakfast. When asked to replace muffin with slices of bread..guess what.they denied. Family next table were saying that they could not slip night before because of all the noise coming from party hall down stairs and when they tried to complain they did not gave them any replacement room. But overall, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Greater Miami Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Publius2003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel, and given what we paid, we have no complaints. It's an adequate, newer facility with decent service and facilities. Granted, the location is not that great, but for less than $50 a night, we didn't complain. The hotel is located right off of the Palmetto Expressway. It is visible from the highway, and easy to find. The hotel has a large amount of free parking, including a three story garage. We found this to be great, given that many hotels in and around Miami charge for their parking. The neighborhood doesn't give the best vibe, but we never felt unsafe. The lobby is large and inviting. The pool and hot tub are located right off the lobby, and were stylish and well lit. We had a third floor room which was large and had nice beds. Most of the ice machines were broken, so we had to take an elevator to the 7th floor to stock up on ice. My main complaint is that the walls are paper thin. We could hear the night club, despite the fact that we were three floors up and across the hotel. Luckily, we travel with a white noise machine. Overall, decent stay. Given the price we paid, I would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “I left my red leather jacket in the closet”
Reviews.Author: Wanda028
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was polite and the room was clean. I had a nice breakfast in the restuarant that morning before I left for the airport. The close proximity to the shopping center was a decided plus. Now the big minus. I live in Chicago. It is usually very cold in December. I wore my leather jacket from Chicago to Miami. In Miami, the jacket was unnecessary when I went shopping, so I hung it in the closet. The next morning, it was warm and balmy and I forgot it when I left for the airport. I arrived in Mexico City and still didn't miss the jacket until the evening. Knowing that lost items are usually kept for thirty days and that I would be returning to Miami on Tuesday on my way back home, I decided to just pick the jacket up on my way home. When I called the hotel, I was told that the jacket had not been turned in. Perhaps I did not wear one. I contacted Travelocity and they told the agent at first that they could not even confirm that I had stayed at the hotel. The security deposit charged on my Visa belied that. Now I am finding it impossible to lodge a complaint. My primary concern now is that I be compensated for my loss. I was sick with a cold for a week upon my return as it was a blustery, 15 degrees on the evening of December 16th and surprise! I had no outer jacket. What is the world coming to when a hotel is willing to lose business to protect a dishonest staff member? Donna A. Nunn Chicago, IL email: DNunn45@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: MMoritz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent. I liked it, excellent location for shopping, excellent staff , everything you need is around the area and the price was excellent for the room and facilities, it included free parking place and also breakfast and Free Wifi .Special attention for Lorenzo , the manager and Daya, they were very polite and helpful.Thanks for all . I think that the breakfast need an improvement something like a buffet. Sincerely Marcelo Moritz,

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY DISSATISFIED”
Reviews.Author: JAGGLADY
Reviews.Content: This place was below my standards! I read the description very well and when I arrived I was disgusted by the look and the location. The front desk and the shuttle driver were very polite! The distance from the airport was a bit further than I expected and the type of people I saw roaming around to get into the night club were thugs! I felt unsafe and horribly dissatisfied when I was told I had to put a $25 deposit down after I had already paid in advance in Aug 09 for this stay! I was on the 2nd flr and heard the night club clearly through the floor! No rest at all! What type of establishment would have a club occupied(Wed) with guest from the streets and roaming the halls when there are paid guest looking for rest and comfort for whatever the reason of staying at this hotel??? The hotel also states that they had renovated and it is so beautiful inside-----LIES! I hope others will trust and believe some of the reviews because no one deserves to read one thing and see another! If all possible, sacrifice and go with a 4-star or 5-star rating! When I departed Miami I was happy to know that I went with a 4-star hotel and much closer to the Miami airport as stated when I booked. I'm calling the BBB and posting pics to back my experience up!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD DEAL”
Reviews.Author: benikana
Reviews.Content: Well , I travel to miami every year, sometimes twice a year, and never stayed in a hotel far from miami beach. but always i rent a car , so i decided do try a budget hotel once. and no regrets at all! this hotel is a good hotel for the money . in 20 minutes you can go to all directions ( aventura... south miami.. miami beach... ) So if you want to spend less money to sleep in a good hotel and you will rent a car , you can stay in this hotel for sure! Very big and confortable room. free wifi in room.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends”
Reviews.Author: mareolulo
Reviews.Content: This is a 100% cuban that is because it is in Hialeah BROTHE!!! The rooms are not that bad. They are clean even though the carpet is dark so you really do not know where is touching your foot. Free parking and free internet. The people who stayed is disgusting,,, they seemed they came form the same exact place; at 10PM the hall is full of empty pizza boxex, and every kind of food, so you can imagine the smell. !! That really sucks. In the lobby that is being upgraded there is a smell of wet carpet that never dried entirely. This place is good for many people. If you are the guy who likes to order food from the neighborhood and throw out the box just out of your door, you are in the right place.!!! I almost forgot. I arrived at night and there was no towels in my tub.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price - Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: brizzyguy
Reviews.Content: Well it's actually quite a long drive from the airport, but there is an airport shuttle if you don't have a rental car. I arrived late at night, after a long flight from Seattle, so all I really needed was a cheap place to sleep and then head off to my next destination the following morning. For the very low price I paid, it was really quite a good hotel, if you consider that a continental breakfast and free Internet in the rooms is included. Also plenty of free parking. There is not much within walking distance, but a short drive east along the 932 road (NW 103rd St) are all the usual fast food outlets that has something for everyone. The Westland Mall is very close if you need that, and there is a gas station across the road. The location seemed fairly safe, I had no concerns about the neighborhood. The fellow guests seemed OK, all nationalities, and social classes - no problems at all with noise, either from adjoining rooms or the highways next to the hotel. The only thing I noticed was a slight stale smell in the corridors and rooms, but I put that down to Miami's humid climate. The beds and pillows were reasonably comfortable and bedding sheets, comforter and quilt were also clean enough. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. All was pre-paid via Expedia, so checkout was a breeze. Overall, for the price you pay for this hotel, it is very good value for money, and I think most people would use this as a sleep over for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly service from all... great value”
Reviews.Author: jvjaen
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel to stay during our vacation in Miami and frankly, were not too confident of what to expect. It was a pleasant surprise, upon arrival and check in, how friendly and serviceable was the staff. At all times they portrayed a friendly smile and offered help for whatever we might need. Although still under renovation, construction work was done in a very neat manner and no disruption of service was experienced. Would definitely stay again at this hotel on our next visit to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “i was very satisfied with everything . planning another trip soon but no rooms are available for my date”
Reviews.Author: jayful
Reviews.Content: both my self and friend was please with the hotel .it was in the correct area for us and the place was clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “I had a good time”
Reviews.Author: JFleury
Reviews.Content: Is a good Hotel. I'm certain to stay again, if possible, in this hotel (Howard Johnson Plaza Hotel Miami Airport 7707 NW 103rd Street, Miami, FL 33016). I would like to contribute to improve the breakfest to sugest a better price for the hots plates.

Reviews.Title: “All that Glitters Isn't Gold!”
Reviews.Author: agodsend624
Reviews.Content: Horror story at check-in- Since the booking was paid in advance on hotels dot com, the hotel demanded a $150.00 Cash deposit at check-in Even though the room had already been paid for in advance. NO one spoke English other than the hotel front desk staff so, Forget about making a request regarding the cleaning staff. You must pay for everything at breakfast except for toast and juice. They charge exceptionally high rates for using the computer at the hotel Charged by the minute-- so whatever you do, please bring your laptop. You are not located NEAR the airport AT ALL! so i do not know why it is called Howard Johnson Miami Airport. The airport is at least a 30 minute drive away. The hotel bus to the airpoty runs only every few hours- You are not near anything in walking distance either... overall.... not recommended by me. Oh and by the way, PLEASE do not believe the photos

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: jivette
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. If after renovation the prices saty the same, it will be a geat place to stay. It is true it is far from Miami action, but for my personal purposes it was just right. I had a tranquil stay, nonetheless, there are enough restaurants and shops to entertain yourself for a couple of hours a day. The pool is nice and clean. It's most deceiving feature is the "fitness center", which has 3 machines of which 2 were out-of-service :( Otherwise, it is great. Another thing: You can eat at the hotel with no worries: Large, 16", 1-ingredient pizza is 10.99 (13.63 after taxes) or 10 chicken wings for 8.99, those are affordavle prices for a hotel. So, if you are going to rebt a car, is great and if you need a nice tranquil stay in which you do not feel confined to your hotel, it's even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel no so good located”
Reviews.Author: NPSTER
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived hotel lobby was being renovated, but were attended fast and effective. Room was great, with a great view. Continental breakfast was ok, however was only served from 07.00 - 10.00 after that is is availible only on a paid basis. If moving around in a cab prepare to pay alot on taxi fare, other than that no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: RaqO
Reviews.Content: The Manager, Flor Chica and the Front Desk Agent, Griselle were exceptional!! The service was superb--they went above and beyond to make our stay pleasurable and memorable. I highly recommend this hotel because of the excellent customer service and convenience. Thank you...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rocker08
Reviews.Content: I travel alot & many times for biz to Miami. I have to admit that I was a little hesitatnt about staying there because of the price, however, I was pleasantly surprised. Mine was a non smoking room which was farly large & clean. Nothing fancy but then again at that price you shouldn't expect anything fancy! The breakfast was fine. The staff were very friendly & helpful everywhere in the hotel - the front desk, the concierge, the bar maid ! Everyone I came across were all super helpful & friendly. Another advantage to this hotel is that they have a desk where you can rent a car. So this is very convenient. No need to rent a car at the airport since you can do it right there at the hotel and the price was also very competitive. I think the only negative thing I can think of is that the shuttle bus takes forever to pick you up. It took at least 45 mins. I am going back again soon & I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Always love staying here. Everyone is very nice.”
Reviews.Author: FranS4444
Reviews.Content: Service desk was excellent....especially Flor and Rene. We have family here and friends and try to spend at least a couple of nights with HJ here. We feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “DOOOOOONT GO!!!!! WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN TO!!!!!!! :/”
Reviews.Author: baboon44
Reviews.Content: this hotel experince was not what it seemed like in the websites. Dont be fooled by the pictures because it doesnt look like a bit at all. When we first arrived we had to wait untill 3:oo p.m even though we had to check out at 11:00. Also it was dirty and underconstruction. The tv's didnt work that good. The atmospher was horriabel also smelly, peoples not friendly;

Reviews.Title: “I was skeptical at first”
Reviews.Author: sarawalker
Reviews.Content: This was my kid's (15, 14 & 9) first visit to Miami. They thoroughly enjoyed it. I wasn't trying to break the bank with lodging and chose the HoJo to stay for a week. The location wasn't the greatest in comparison to the beaches, but we did drive to South Beach with no problem. The room was very clean and we must have gotten a more updated room because the bathroom was just fine. The front desk staff was great and the continental breakfast was ok. Nothing to get full off of, but it was fine. My oldest wanted to go to the exercise room and he was back within 5 minutes; it was very poor. We probably won't use this hotel again when we visit, only because it wasn't in the most convenient place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: jwinhsv
Reviews.Content: This was my first stop in the States after an extended overseas trip. I selected it for two reasons: advertised proximity to the airport w/ ease of pickup, and advertised top-grade 24/7 business center. Upon arriving in Miami, I discovered that their airport shuttle only runs once an hour and only makes one stop at the airport. I found the spot and waited the hour, but the shuttle went whizzing by in the outside lane without even looking to see if there were passengers to pick up. So I waited another hour till I finally got picked up. Then I find that the hotel is actually a half hour away from the airport. Yes, as the crow flies, it's close to a mall and restaurants, but they neglect to mention that it's on the other side of a freeway, with no easy sidewalk access, and on the Sunday evening when i arrived, everything was closed anyway. (Does Florida still have blue laws?) So nowhere to eat except the very unsatisfactory hotel restaurant, and nothing else available to do. A priority was the use of their business center, since I needed to re-establish some important communications after several weeks away. When I first asked, I was told the man in charge of the business center was running errands and would be back with the key within a half hour. An hour later, I was told that the business center never does open on Sunday (even though the sign on the door said 24/7). Still later I was told that the business center wasn't operational at all at that time, and indeed when I looked through the window, it was piled high with boxes and obviously being used as a storage room. It was difficult to find employees who spoke understandable English, and without exception the employees were rude and unhelpful. I am generally not hard to please, but I would advise travelers to avoid this one at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Even for free, wish we didn't stay here”
Reviews.Author: EricToronto
Reviews.Content: Wow, we were put up at the HoJo by United after our flight was canceled. This place was a dump. When we arrived, the hotel was almost full with other passengers from our plane. They put us up in the Penthouse suite, just another room on the top floor. We could hear the traffic from the highway...it almost sounded like the highway went through our room, even with the balcony door closed. Our friends, put up in another Penthouse room, found hair in the shower. The room felt dirty and we slept in our clothes. The area is not the nicest but there was a mall across from the hotel. We spent most of our time away from the hotel. Having said that, the lobby was nice. The employee's were pleasant. There were people sitting around the pool. If your looking for a very inexpensive stay and you don't mind the location, it might be a decent, inexpensive option.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FAYF
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights, mainly because it was a lot less expensive than other hotels that I was considering. On arriving, we were given a room on the 2nd floor, which was clean and serviceable, but I noticed a rather loud buzzing coming from (I think) a nearby utility room. It wasn't a big deal, and I would have stayed in that room if it was just for one night, but my husband decided to ask if they could switch us to another room. The concierge was very friendly and immediately offered us an upgraded room on a higher floor, since they didn't have any more basic rooms. The upgraded room was actually a "Home Office Room" and was bigger than the first room and had a larger desk, mini-fridge and extra armchair. It also looked generally newer so I presume it was renovated more recently. They usually charge an extra $10 or so for this type of room, which I think is definitely worth it. At any rate, we had a very comfortable stay - comfortable bed, clean and roomy bathroom, and nice freebies like internet and parking (which my other hotel choices would have charged extra for). There are plenty of chain restaurants nearby, as well as grocery stores, so it's convenient, but certainly not in a hip area of town. However, we had a car and it was never more than 20-30 minutes to get to any destination - South Beach, Dolphin Mall, etc. Someone else mentioned a funny smell in the hallways - I noticed this too - I think it's the cleaning solution they use. Of note, the rooms do NOT have any objectionable smells. In summary, this is a well-maintained business hotel. The decor is pretty generic and it is an older property, but the rooms are very comfortable and clean. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “It's”
Reviews.Author: traveller20099
Reviews.Content: Ok for one night stay. The hotel is fine, the rooms were clean, but the furniture were a little dated. The service is good, friendly staff and the continental breakfast is not bad. It had a little bit funny smell in the hall... And it's far from the Miami action. I was a little worried after reading some of the review, I was expecting a dump! It's good for the price yopu pay, it's worth for one night before cruise. Oh! and the shuttle to the hotel took forever to pick us up!

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: mytup
Reviews.Content: while visiting family in miami, my wife became sick and needed to stay for a day in our room. Auyelia, the lady who was cleaning the rooms, took a special interest in checking on my wife to make sure she had everything she needed. thanks for the extra attention, Auyelia. I understand that the hotel will be fixing up the worn carpets and updating the hotel in general. those upgrades are needed to bring a decent hotel up a notch in quality. But the extra service is more than enough to earn my recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here.....”
Reviews.Author: asder123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights and unfortunately this hotel did not meet our expectations at all. At first we had to wait almost two hours before the shuttle arrived to pick us up from miami airport, even though the hotel promised us to pick us up within 20 minutes. The driver did not speak english, he could only say "happy today, everything okay", while driving 20 mph where 40 mph was the minimum speed and paying more attention to his phone than the road. The drive to the hotel took about 45 minutes and we were glad to get out of the shuttle, only to see the horrible state of the hotel itself. It's very grey and dull inside and the rooms are not properly cleaned at all. We found hairs of other people in the room, and the carpet was so dirty we did not want to walk without shoes on. Fortunately the hotel has free internet, so after the first inspection of the room we immediately booked another hotel (Sofitel airport, just 40 dollars more, but totally different atmosphere and quality and close to the airport) and we were out of there within 20 minutes.
